Processes_inputs Module¶

process_inputs.add2log(string, variable, lines)¶

Adds variables to log.

Parameters

  • string (string) – Variable name.

  • variable (float, string or 1D array) – Value of the variable.

  • lines (int) – Number of lines to write the log. Current options are in one line (1) or two lines (2).

process_inputs.add2log_break(btype)¶

Adds a break line or space to the input log.

Parameters

btype (string) – Break type. Currently takes a line break (“l”) or space break (“s”).

process_inputs.eval_equation(str_input, start_value, end_value, ds)¶

Evaluates a single variable equation at discrete points and produces an array containing the solutions at each point.

Parameters

  • str_input (string) – Single variable equation - variable must be r.

  • start_value (float) – Starting value

  • end_value (float) – Ending value

  • ds (float) – Step between each point

process_inputs.extractfromfile(fname)¶

Extracts compressional and shear velocity, density, maximum and minimum raduis and radial data points from a model text file (e.g. PREM). Assumes the model file is isotropic.

Parameters

fname (string) – File name containing the input model.

process_inputs.input_log(inputs)¶

Initalizes a log file to store the user inputs and other parameters used for calculations or plotting.

Parameters

inputs (object) – Users command line inputs.

process_inputs.nearest(lst, k)¶

Finds the nearest value in an array and its index.

Parameters

  • lst (1D array) – Array of numbers

  • k (float) – Value to find

process_inputs.process_inputs(inputs)¶

Takes oject storing the user inputs and returns an model object with specifications for mode calculations.

Parameters

inputs (object) – Users command line inputs

process_inputs.str2array(str_in, delim)¶

Converts a list of strings to 1D array.

Params str_in

String list (e.g. ‘1,2,3,4’)

Params delim

Delimiter separating the values

Class:

  • Model Class
